intro: Ferraria elongata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferraria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spikes of small, white or pale blue flowers. Ferraria elongata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
